messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4202
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/15/2003 8:53:19 AM Central Standard Time, sjogy@sbcglobal.net writes: When this happened to Quinn, I told him that he was really good at
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/15/2003 8:53:19 AM Central Standard Time,
sjogy@... writes:
When this happened to Quinn, I told him that he was really good at math
(true), but that he had just never done "paper math." That satisfied him.
~~~

Yep, I said something like that, too. I said he had never done it like they
did it in school.

Tuck


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4202
messages.msgSnippet: on 11/14/03 7:38 PM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at ... When this happened to Quinn, I told him that he was really good at math (true), but that he
messages.messageBody:
on 11/14/03 7:38 PM, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com at
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> We talked some. I told him I was sad that he thought he was "not good at
> math". I told him I thought maybe I hadn't been very good at making numbers
> and
> math a part of his life like I had letters and reading.

When this happened to Quinn, I told him that he was really good at math
(true), but that he had just never done "paper math." That satisfied him.

Paula
